chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas A Tierney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to submit DNA Sample. If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant to cooperate with any treatment/counseling deemed appropriate by agent, no contact w/victim or her sisters, no contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior agent approval, not be present in a location that is frequented by minor children without prior agent approval, register and comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by Atty Middleton

3:32 PM Defendant Thomas A Tierney in court from the Columbia County Jail.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II  and Attorney Allison Borsheim in court for Thomas A Tierney. Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has received PSI and Sentencing Memorandum, Court sentences defendant to: Ct. 1, 35 years prison, 15 years initial confinement, 20 years extended supervision, sentence to commence forthwith, $518.00 costs, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, cooperate with any treatment/counseling deemed appropriate by agent, no contact w/victim or her sisters, no contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior agent approval, not be present in a location that is frequented by minor children without prior agent approval, register and comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry, Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program, 233 days sentence credit, 4:11 P.M.

9:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Thomas A Tierney in court, in custody. Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II in court for Thomas A Tierney. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Agreement recited by state. Sentencing will not be argued. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 of the information.
